ED_Title: Postponement of the seventy-second session of the International Law Commission
ED_DecisionText:
On 23 June 2020, the General Assembly, on the proposal of its President (A/74/L.70) ,	 recalling its resolution 74/186 of 18 December 2019, in which it had decided that the International Law Commission would hold its seventy-second session at the United Nations Office at Geneva from 27 April to 5 June and from 6 July to 7 August 2020, recalling also its decision 74/545 of 2 April 2020, in which it had decided to postpone the first part of the seventy-second session of the Commission and to extend by one week the second part of the session so that it would be held from 29 June to 7 August 2020, and taking into account the continuing situation concerning the coronavirus disease (COVID-19),

Decided that the seventy-second session of the International Law Commission shall be postponed to a later date.
ED_Disclaimer: The final version of decisions adopted during the resumed part of the session will be contained in the official record of the GA (A/74/49 (Vol. III)) after editorial review.
